page.title: 08THE GENERAL STORE
page.content: The{General Store}in{Hulland Ward}was not always a store.It was once a {saddlery}selling goods for use with {horses.}The owners have lived in the store for{six years}and they employ {twelve people,eight}who{deliver}the {newspaper,}and{four}who help in the store.The shop opens at{six o'clock}in the{morning}until{six o'clock}at{night on{Monday}to{Saturday,}but on{Sunday they open from{six}in the{morning until{one}in the{afternoon.}Altogether they work{seventy eight hours}a week. They have{lorries}to transport their goods from the{wholesaler.}The most popular food sold is{bread.}The most common{newspaper}sold is the{Daily {Telegraph.}Amongst a variety of items,they sell{ice cream,sweets, {biscuits,drinks}etc. They also run a {video hire.
